PolicyPage.Name: Pathway Retake Eligibility
PolicyPage.Title: Pathway Retake Eligibility
PolicyPage.BodyCopy:
Pathway students are always welcome to take the gathering version of a Pathway course as a retake. This is based on availability of the course.  If a student meets the following criteria, they can take the online non-gathering version of a Pathway course for retake.  In some cases, these students will need to be given a requirement authorization to register for the retake course.

Online only eligibility:

  •  Academic Start students are eligible to register for the online only version of a Pathway course if they earned a grade ranging from a B- to a D- in the traditional gathering version of the course and a retake is needed in order to improve cumulative GPA and progress towards matriculation. 

 

  • The student can choose to take the online only version during the same semester as another gathering course during Academic Start, if approved or they wait until their gathering courses are complete.  This decision should be made in counsel with their Academic Advisor.

 

  • If a student receives a W in a Pathway course, they must retake the gathering version in order to fulfill residency requirements.  They are not eligible for the online only version of the course.

 

  • Students desiring to take the online only version of a course due to relocation or any other reason will need to petition.  These situations will be decided on a case by case basis.
